Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: Lynne F
Reviews.Content: I found the reception staff helpful and pleasant and there was a bus service on metres away from the entrance taking me directly to the city centre. The room was cleaned each day during my week's stay and suited my needs well. Loved the deep bath with plenty of hot water. Would prefer to see little toiletries discontinued as there is so much wastage with small plastic packaging. Soap dispensers are more eco-friendly. Wifi was not always reliable and it was inconvenient to have to ask for a new password every 24 hours. Unlike previous reviews I had no trouble adjusting the cooling in the room. It was quiet and not so much light in the room that it bothered me particularly. I got the distinct impression that the focus in this hotel was on making money from business travellers whose company pays the bill, rather than provide service. For example, no tea/coffee in the room and this had to be paid for in the lobby along with everything else. I refused to pay 18 euros for breakfast, and walked to a nearby coffee shop instead. On my return to Madrid another hotel was recommended to me at a far cheaper rate, with excellent free wifi & a delicious, free buffet breakfast. From a seasoned traveller's perspective, you don't actually make money charging extra, instead you lose customers - worth keeping in mind. This hotel could be so much better simply by focusing on meeting the needs of guests, especially by including breakfast, providing a better wifi service and having an iron available.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and bad AC”
Reviews.Author: lourdesferreiro
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we stayed in in Madrid. Of course I'm sure there are worst ones but this was supposed to be a good hotel. The AC did not work, the room was very small and you could not close the drapes, which meant the light was shining in the room in the middle of the night. The price was lower than some hotels we stayed in; that should have given us a clue. But, it wasn't really cheap. I'm sure you can find a better hotel for the price. We were very dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good marketing”
Reviews.Author: Scrofatofalu
Reviews.Content: Good hotel experience, slightly expensive for what you get. A lot of marketing and product placment. Breakfast is call "de-tox breakfast" and therefore they charge 18€ for it! Actually they refer to the available fruit and rocket leaves which are heavily out numbered by the tox items such as bacon, cheese, cakes etc etc. Good normal but well over priced.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better hotels in Madrid- AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Jane W
Reviews.Content: I checked in for one night on 11 May; a couple of days after the start of Madrid's high temperatures. I asked about the air conditioning and was advised that the air conditioning was not due to be turned on for a few more days and there was nothing they could do about it. Asked for an electric fan - none available. Told to open the window, which I had to, the temperature in the room at midnight was over 35. All the street lights shone into the room and of course all of the street noises could be heard - rubbish trucks, speeding cars, and late night partying. Breakfast was poor for choice and the hot food was cold. The staff at the desk were all arrogant and did not care about my or my fellow travellers comfort

Reviews.Title: “Bad service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mirte L
Reviews.Content: Small and noisy room, very bad service, a lot of money for what you get! My advise go to another hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great rate”
Reviews.Author: JuliaDuran
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, not the largest room I've ever seen... but enough space for resting after a day visiting Madrid. EXCELENT Breakfast. Great location.-

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you need fast internet”
Reviews.Author: traveler9128374
Reviews.Content: The charge for so-called high speed internet was EUR 17 per day (as opposed to economy for 10 EUR a day). It worked slower than a medium-speed connection: the connection went off every once in a while, calls were interrupted, emailing was difficult, when attachments were involved almost impossible. File transfers or remote desktop inefficient to work with. After calling external assistance after half a day, the options were to remain with the same connection (perhaps new access code) or terminate with a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “A bit no-frills, but perfectly decent”
Reviews.Author: megpickard
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the bigger, plusher, shinier NH Eurobuilding nearby, but they hadn't got any rooms left, so I stayed at NH La Habana instead. It gave the impression of a busy hotel with high nightly turnaround, which would make sense given its proximity to the football stadium, but as a result it felt rather impersonal and perfunctory. I can't complain about the comfort of the room, the quality of sleep or the breakfast - all were fine, but nothing to write home about. The reception staff were efficient though there was a long queue for both checkin and checkout. In a nutshell, if you need to be in that particular area of Madrid for business or a football match, this place does the job, though you won't be gushing about it to the neighbours when you get home.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, rude staff and food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: IsabelTM
Reviews.Content: I was invited to give conferences in a Madrid university and they booked in this hotel because it was in the neighborhood . Unfortunately i confirmed the bad opinion I already had of Nh chain. The single room was tiny, the bed next to the wall and little space to work. If I wanted wireless in the room I would have to pay so I preferred to work on the lobby where I could get 30 minutes of wireless. Yesterday I had to check out two hours before my conference (or else I would have to pay by the hour to keep my room...).I decided to eat an hamburger in the cafeteria which reviewing my notes and during the night I felt nauseous and today I was diagnosed with mild food poisoning. And the worst thing was the service:rude staff, not a smile or an excuse when people complained because there was no more hot milk or coffee in the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: gary136
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the football spurs v real game. I found the staff very frendly & helpful I had a single room the room was very small but adequart ,no tea making facelity in room,good selection of toiletries in the bathroom.The breakfast was e18-00 for a buffet style,The bed in the bedroom kept moving away from the wall as it had wheels on it the floor was a lamanate. The hotel was very clean and pleasent,but I have stayed in better 3 star hotels. I would stay hear again but only for a short stay. The hotel is great access to real madrid 's ground and the metro is a short walk away which can give you great access to other parts of madrid. taxi fare to the airport was e24,but the metro is e3.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: DinahTate
Reviews.Content: I booked this via a lastminute.com special offer and was rather worried to read the reviews on here. In practice it was fine. I paid for a single room but they gave me a double; nice big comfortable bed; nothing wrong with the decor that I could see - spacious bathroom, lovely tangerine-scented toiletries. The room was hot but hey you can always open the window. The safe was big enough to put my laptop in. I had my dongle so didn't use the free internet but NB if you want to use it you do need an ethernet cable. There was no sign of tea+coffee making facilities in my room but to be fair I wasn't bothered and didn't ask about it. Despite being on a main road it was not especially noisy - no noisy nightly bin collecting here! The chambermaid was a sweetie, always with a happy smile; the reception staff were very helpful, making phone calls for me when I had problems with my inadequate grasp of Spanish, and printing boarding passes etc. Moreover this hotel has ramps everywhere so is presumably wheelchair friendly, but certainly very useful if like me you have heavy luggage. No complaints at all and I will stay here again if I need to be in the Castellana area of Madrid another time.

Reviews.Title: “No iron, no internet, no incoming calls first 18 hours”
Reviews.Author: mhljones
Reviews.Content: This is the only supposedly three star hotel that I have ever stayed in that does cannot supply an iron or ironing board to guests. They suggested that if I wish to dre-wrinkle my shirts and trousers after unpacking them, that I pay to send them out! Not only did in-room internet not work when I checked in, but also I was unable to receive incoming calls (from a Sunday at about 15:00 to Monday at about 10:30). In short, NOT up to NH's usual standard, and not a "three star" facility.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Ronald_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of its excellent location because it's very close to the Real Madrid stadium (just a five minute walk.) The hotel has the standard NH-quality, so no surprises on that point. To me it's important not to be disturbed by traffic noise, other guests and so on. Regarding this it was a good choice to select this hotel. Will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, poor service, everything is extra$, cannot recommend”
Reviews.Author: braneout
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small even by European standards, beds uncomfortable, maid service is not good (often missed obvious things like towels in the tub), the mini-bar was left with empty beer bottles, and they gouge you on internet service (they advertised free wi-fi but it is only in the lobby, and parceled out 30 minutes at a time). The breakfast looks decent but is actually rather thin and not particularly good. Only positives are that there is a bathtub and the hotel is not far from Columbia stop on the Metro, and as such is convenient to the airport (and Bernabeau). I´ve stayed at many NH hotels and this was the worst. Not recommended for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the buck”
Reviews.Author: labreu79
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, staff was friendly, 2-min walk from Colombia Metro station, and affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of promises... not a lot of follow through”
Reviews.Author: HeatherBowman
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a bunch of amenities listed but did not pull through. They had internet at 17 Euros a day!!! Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if going to see Real Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, very clean, welcoming and well organised. Comfortable room. We stayed for 3 nights whilst visiting Madrid to watch a game at the Santiago Bernabeu and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lucinarei
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and a great place to stay if you are visiting Madrid. We stayed here for one night and were extremely pleased with everything. The staff, the room, and the location were all excellent. The price was also great- we paid 50 euros for the one night. Highly recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: NH La Habana
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo de la Habana 73, 28036 Madrid, Spain
